content:
just reserving this topic...

I think there's likely to be not too much discussion today, mostly a triage check in.

before I forget -- I noticed that the stabilization of Iterator::reduce (#79805) did not get mentioned in the 1.51 release notes. I'd like to know what process we missed, but maybe it just needed the relnotes label
@T-release meeting!
alright
Looks like @DPC isn't here today
ah i'm here
ah, ok, well, then triage update?
nothing much from my side
ok
Let's shift to @cuviper's question there
had the scheduled monthly meeting a few days back, things seem normal just wiating on progress of triage dashboard to be completed
@XAMPPRocky I think you know most about the process there
I think it’s just a lack of relnotes tag
ok, so we just need to remind T-libs that we use that?
ok! I seemed to recall we had finished FCPs as part of the filter as well, maybe we don't though?
Most of those are at least plausible candidates (possibly for compat notes, if not the main section)
Maybe the tool missed the merge date, but I’ve been using the beta cutoff dates for merges so we should be catching anything on the edge
the milestone should be more accurate than dates
hm, yeah, milestones are probably the thing to use
I thought it needs to be when we cut the beta, as that’s what’s in tree?
the prs are milestoned precisely on the beta cut-off
so they're an accurate representation of when PRs will hit stable
Just to answer your previous question I don’t think fcp’s are ignored. I’ll make a PR with the config I use to release-team so it’s accessible.
thanks!
alright, @triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
alright
@triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
where are we on team chartering?
so I have a meeting later today, but the charter doc as I sent it around a while back is still the canonical doc I believe
should we talk about it in one of these meetings, or is this a "speak now or forever hold your peace"?
(not that I have any issues at the moment)

they're definitely going to be living documents regardless, but it was my impression that folks didn't have much feedback as there wasn't too much traffic on the doc. if that's wrong I'm definitely happy to spend meeting time or 1:1s with folks on it!
it's been in my backlog to review more closely
ok, I would say that reviewing closely is definitely a good idea
if folks could PM me on zulip or shoot me an email once they feel satisfied they've reviewed it that'd be good, ideally by end of next week
it happens that my work has a planned outage today, so that opens me up for other stuff :)

it's my understanding/hope that the content in there currently is the "possibly controversial" stuff, and I'll be working with the folks running the chartering on the less controversial bits around that
@triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
ok
@triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
alright
thanks everyone!
